summary: This is an FBI FD-302 interview summary of JOSEPHINE, conducted on March 3, 2021. The witness provides information about her connections to the cosmetics/trade show industry, her encounters with individuals linked to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, and her recollection of Jeffrey Epstein being her substitute teacher in high school. She also describes suspicious events and conversations involving other associates.

persons.name: JOSEPHINE
persons.context: The primary interviewee providing information to the FBI. She worked as an art director in the cosmetics industry, attended trade shows, and knew several individuals connected to the case, including having Jeffrey Epstein as a substitute teacher in high school.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as a central figure in the case. The witness states he was her substitute teacher at George Washington High School from 1975-1976 and later re-encountered him in a different context.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The witness met her at trade shows, recognized her face from photographs, and recalls a specific interaction with her in Bologna.

persons.name: Eva Dubin
persons.context: Met by the witness at trade shows. Described as the wife's doctor of the witness's boss and as someone who hung out with Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Glen Dubin
persons.context: Mentioned as being present at a trade show in New Orleans and as having grown up in the same neighborhood as Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Ernst Gubler
persons.context: Described as part of the FING'RS organization, which the witness believed was part of a cult. He had homes in Germany and Switzerland, and the witness overheard a concerning conversation at his Swiss home.

persons.name: Leon Black
persons.context: Mentioned as being present at the same trade show in New Orleans as Glen Dubin.

persons.name: Jimmy Savile
persons.context: Described as the entertainment for the night at the trade show in New Orleans that the witness found disgusting.

persons.name: Freddy Frei
persons.context: Mentioned in a conversation overheard by the witness at Gubler's Swiss home. He later told the witness he had done 'terrible things'. He is noted as deceased.

persons.name: Len Indelicato
persons.context: Described as the witness's favorite boss until she learned he was 'involved' because he was around people like Ernst Gubler. She believes he 'knows everything'.

persons.name: Dino Lamperello (Dino Valendino)
persons.context: A key player from New York who worked at FING'RS. He bragged about getting Picasso artwork and had a conflict with Dana Siegel.

persons.name: Dana Siegel
persons.context: Described as a 'crazy young lady' who was a designer of tween products at WWC. She had a conflict with Dino Lamperello and was also pushed out of the company.

persons.name: Fairchild
persons.context: Met by the witness at FING'RS and described as having a 'stinky attitude'. The witness later read an article linking Fairchild to Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Harvey Weinstein
persons.context: Mentioned because the witness has a photograph of him receiving an award at a cosmetics show, which she found odd.

persons.name: Coco Brown
persons.context: One of the individuals the witness has met, listed alongside Eva Dubin and Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Lewis
persons.context: Mentioned as possibly being in a photograph with Eva Dubin and Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Amanda Nicole Young
persons.context: One of the interviewing agents who drafted the FD-302 document.

persons.name: Kelly Maguire
persons.context: One of the interviewing agents who drafted the FD-302 document.

connections.description: The witness states they grew up in the same neighborhood (Washington Heights).
The witness states that Eva Dubin hung out with Ghislaine Maxwell.
The witness overheard a conversation between them at Gubler's home in Switzerland.
The witness states Indelicato was around Gubler and other involved people, leading her to believe he was involved.
Dino followed Dana Siegel and they later became enemies, according to the witness.
The witness read an article stating Fairchild was involved with Jeffrey Epstein, and notes the company that bought FING'RS was owned by Epstein.
The witness had Epstein as a substitute teacher in 1975-76 and later had a friendship where he would ask her about parties.

events.title: Epstein as Substitute Teacher
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was a substitute teacher at the witness's high school, George Washington High School.

events.title: FBI Interview of JOSEPHINE
events.description: JOSEPHINE was interviewed telephonically by FBI Special Agents Amanda Nicole Young and Kelly Maguire regarding her knowledge of individuals and events connected to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Trade Show in New Orleans
events.description: The witness attended a trade show in New Orleans she described as 'really awful' and 'disgusting' because she was in a room full of 'perverted men'. Glen Dubin and Leon Black were present, and Jimmy Savile was the entertainment.

events.title: Conversation at Gubler's Swiss Home
events.description: While at Ernst Gubler's house on a lake in Switzerland during a trade show, the witness overheard a conversation between Freddy Frei and another man where one said, 'this is where the children come from.'

events.title: FING'RS Photo Shoot with Young Model
events.description: The witness did a photo shoot for FING'RS where she photographed a model she believed was around 16 or 17 years old, who appeared high and was brought in a limo. She thought the model's name might have been Nikki.

locations: New York, New York, United States
Bologna (presumably Italy, site of a trade show)
New Orleans (site of a trade show)
Switzerland (location of Ernst Gubler's home on a lake)
California (where Len Indelicato was the witness's boss)
Brazil (mentioned in context of sex trafficking and a woman who took care of a girl)
keyFacts: The witness, JOSEPHINE, states that Jeffrey Epstein was her substitute teacher at George Washington High School from 1975 to 1976.
The witness alleges that the alumni list from George Washington High School 'connects a lot of players to Epstein.'
The witness overheard a disturbing comment, 'this is where the children come from,' in a conversation at Ernst Gubler's Swiss home involving Freddy Frei.

The witness describes a trade show in New Orleans attended by Glen Dubin and Leon Black, with Jimmy Savile as entertainment, which she found 'pretty disgusting' due to the presence of 'perverted men.'

The witness suggests a network within the cosmetics/trade show industry, linking individuals like Ernst Gubler, Ghislaine Maxwell, Eva and Glen Dubin, and others to a suspicious 'cult'-like organization (FING'RS).
